Guidione Machava is a product designer with over a decade of experience designing complex digital tools across startups, international organizations, and high-growth platforms. His work spans early-stage MVPs to enterprise systems, with a strong focus on clarity, usability, and product impact.

At Shopify, he led design across all blockchain initiatives, shaping tools at the intersection of commerce and emerging technology. At the World Bank, he focused on designing digital solutions for emerging markets. He also has served as a product manager, overseeing cross-functional teams distributed across Europe, North America, and Asia.

He is the founder of the World-Class Designer School and the author of Design Sutra, a book on foundational design principles. Farai Madzima is a UX strategist with deep experience in enterprise product design. Over the past 15 years, he has helped teams across financial services, e-commerce, and SaaS simplify complex workflows and ship thoughtful, scalable software.

At Shopify, he was part of the UX leadership team, where he helped launch Shopify Balance (serving over 80,000 monthly users) and Shopify Capital, a platform responsible for over $5 billion in small business loans. Prior to that, he scaled Standard Bank‚Äôs UX team across 18 African markets, shaping design capability inside one of the continent‚Äôs largest financial institutions.

He‚Äôs also the founder of Pixel Up!, a conference focused on advancing design practice, and a frequent speaker and coach on global stages like SmashingConf and Leading Design, where he shares insights on leadership, systems thinking, and inclusive product strategy.
